page.title: 19Northern Cheam, Surrey.
page.content: Northern Cheam used to be an area of fields, hedgerows and farms but now is part of the residential suburb of Cheam. The houses, built on London clay, consist mainly of three bedroomed, semi_detached or terraced houses typical of the inter_war period. Most houses have small front gardens and longer rear gardens in various states of cultivation. St.Dunstan's Hill, a busy main road, runs north_south across the area. Northern Cheam is a maze of minor roads but open spaces such as Sutton Football ground and small parks do exist. Services are fairly limited and the small number of shops only serve the immediate community: they include a newsagent, a grocer, a DIY store and several public houses.It is a pleasant area in which to live and the majority of houses are occupied by families.
